detailsOfAchievement: Cultural Academy started its function since last 30 years. As an organization committed to the empowerment, safety and security of women and children, cultural academy strives to seek more effective means to transform and inspire progress in the lives it touches. Cultural academy has been involved in the rehabilitation and reintegration programs since the last 25 years and now has been running two institutions Nirbhaya and Shantibhavan. We provide scientific and systematic rehabilitation to the residents. Ujjawala â€“ A program that gives care and support, shelter for women and children who are the victim of domestic violence ,sexual abuse trafficking and other women and children who are in dangerous and difficult situation. We have wide network with various cross sections of society ie government departments, Police departments, Lawyers forum, Universities, colleges, religious groups, women activists groups. Cultural academy functions as a resource centre , where the documents on different governments schemes are available .We help various organization in policy making ie Gender policy, NGO policy, NGO government collaboration policy, policy amendment in children policy, women empowerment policy. Cultural academy rescued and rehabilitated a large number of women and child victims. We successfully sensitized and trained several government and non government officials on gender and women empowerment. Government refers many NGOâ€™s to cultural academy for giving guidance and support and various occasions. We were able to make a considerable change in the life of inhabitance at Vypeen Island. We also formed 20 daycare centres in the Vypeen Panchayat various activities for children, lead to the formation of childrenâ€™s club in the village. Road mapping and participatory rural appraisal was conducted successfully in Vypeen. We also published a book, â€Vypeen society transforming in to a vibrant communityâ€, regarding the whole SPED project. We developed national and international linkages with several groups. Periodically we are doing the monitoring and evaluation of the projects. Cultural academy from its date of inception has been engaged in giving training and empowerment programs to different sections of in the society. The training department provides training in women empowerment, Gender sensitization, Legal literacy, human rights trainings, effective communication, Masculinity, Counseling, Mediation Trainings have been imparted to police officials, other NGOâ€™s, Womens organization, men from various sectors like Advocates, Doctors, Students, Religious leaders , Teachers, Businessmen ,Academic institutions of different social organizations schools and college students. Cultural academy has a professional team of experts who have been rendering their services along with the management of the organization. detailsOfAchievement: Darsan Foundation was established in March 2002 by a group of dynamic young youths with a vision of an alternative model of development, which is economically, socially, environmentally sustainable, which provides basic needs for all upholding the values such as equality, justice and integrity. The objective of Darsan Foundation is to plan and execute integral development project to improve the living condition and welfare of women, children and backward sections of rural Keral. Darsan Foundation implemented a project for Rain Water Harvesting with the aid of CAPART. Darsan Foundation is the Support NGO of Tsunami Emergency Assistance Project(TEAP), Fisheries Dept. Govt. of Kerala. Darsan Foundation is exempted from the payment of tax and got 12 A registration from the Income Tax Commissioner. Darsan Foundation provides awareness generation programmes in the field of legal, Environmental, HIV/AIDS etc.

detailsOfAchievement: KARUNYAVARSHAM STARTED ON 10TH APRIL, 2011 BY SERVING MEALS TO 100 PATIENTS IN GOVT MEDICAL COLLEGE HOSPITAL, ERNAKULAM, KALAMASSERY AND SUBSEQUENTLY REGISTERED WITH THE SUB REGISTRAR, THRIKKAKA DURING DECEMBER 2013. NOW WE HAVE BEEN SERVING FOOD TO MORE THAN 300 PATIENTS AND THEIR BYSTANDERS IN THE SAME HOSPIT FROM MONDAY TO SATURDAY AND TWO MEALS ON SUNDAYS. WE ARE PLANNING TO SERVE THREE MEALS EVERY DAY WITH NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO WOMEN AND CHILDREN. WE ARE ALSO PROVING AMBULANCE, LAB TEST CHARGES, MEDICINE CHARGES TO THE POOREST OF THE POOR PEOPLE. WE ARE ALSO RUNNING A FAMILY CONSELLING CENTRE, AT PALARIVATTOM, ERNAKULAM. IT IS MEANT FOR FAMILY, CHILDREN, INDIVIDUALS ETC. WE HAVE SUPPLIED FOOD PACKETS TO THE FAMILIES WHERE THEIR BREAD WINNER IS BED RIDDEN. we ARE ALSO RUNNING A PALLIATIVE HOME CARE SERVICE IT HELPS THE PATIENTS FOR THEIR NURSING NEEDS. WE ARE ALSO PROVING SUPPORTING EQUIPMENTS SUCH AS AIR BED, WHEEL CHAIR ETC TO THE BED RIDDEN PATIENTS.

Kathakali Festival 2018 was celebrated on 22,23&24 of February 2018 at Trichur .Speciality of this year celebration was the commemoration of 3 doyens of Kathakali ,Kottrarakara Thampuran,Kottayam Thampuran&Unnayi Warrior.Eminent artists performed all the three days.It was well attended by public especially Younger generation.State Ministers,MLA ,MP participated and watched the performances All the three days were well covered in the leading news papers and electronic media.
The amount was utilised for Kathakali Ulsavam 2018 which was celebrated at Agrasala Of Paramekavu Temple Detaied report already submitted

On 10th March 2019 we conducted full night Kathakali engaging eminent artists in their respective field. Dr Jayasankar IRS Commissioner of Income Tax inagurated the Festival.Dr P M Warior Chief Physcian and trustee Ayavydysala Kottakal was our chief guest .Every year we award one soverign gold medal to an outstanding kathakali artist and in 2019 it was given to Kalamandalam Rammohan ,the renowned costume developer This followed Majorset Kathakali participated by Padmasree Dr Kalamandalam Gopi

address: Kathakali School Society Centre for the Performing Arts and Culture Cheruthuruthy Thrissur-679531 Kerala
title: Kathakali School
detailsOfAchievement: Kathakali School, a centre for performing arts and culture is situated in Cheruthuruthy, Kerala, India since 1990. It is the unified effort of a group of the alumni of Kerala Kalamandalam led by Kalamandalam Gopalakrishnan. The Kathakali School staff are highly qualified and eminent performers. We are primarily a teaching institution and the school concentrates on the classical performing arts of Kerala, Kathakali, Mohiniyattam and Theyyam along with several folk and martial arts forms like Kalaripayattu. Kathakali School has performed in almost every continents. In India the school has conducted a number of programmes and workshops for Government and Private Organizations at all major Indian cities. The main workshops were conducted at Bangalore, Mumbai and Hyderabad at various times for CCRT, Govt of India. The Kendra Sangeetha Nataka Academy has also conducted workshops with the school. Kathakali School usually participates in partnership with Kerala Tourism at several places in India. We are also participants in the Govt. of India Cultural Exchange programmes with schools abroad. The south and north zone cultural centres frequently invite Kathakali School for workshops and performances. We feel we have shared in the efforts to preserve and propagate the ancient art forms that define Kerala.

detailsOfAchievement: Kerala Educational Development and Employment Society (KEDES) established in 1983 aims to reduce poverty by investing in the development of human capital with the aim of building skills and making knowledge available to all members of civil society for longterm sustainable development.KEDES encourages, and assists villagers to set up rural and small industries under the Micro & Small Industries Programme of the Govt. of India so as to give relief to the poor by providing full-time or part-time employment after imparting necessary training and ensure fair and reasonable wages. The emphais of KEDES is in organising vocationa, skill based training, ICT controlled education/online education that are employment oriented apart from providing general awareness for inclusive growth. In this respect CAPART, of the Ministry of Rural Development, Govt. of India had assessed the functioning of KEDES in 2008 and published its success stories. This is the first in Kerala and 52nd in the country since the inception of CAPART in 1986.

detailsOfAchievement: The Kerala Statistical Institute (KSI) was established in December 1977 as a professional, non-commercial organization by a group of experts in statistics, economics, management and education. Since its inception, the Institute has carried out projects funded or supported by Government of India, Government of Kerala, renowned institutions like the Centre for Development Studies (CDS) and international agencies. KSI has proven capabilities and is fully geared to undertake major project assignments in an integrated basis from planning to analysis to, report writing as per pre-assigned time frame with an eye on qualitative aspects. The Institute has a live panel of experienced field supervisors and well trained investigators (male / female) located in all districts of the State and in neighbouring States. The panel consists of graduates / post-graduates. Most of the projects handled by KSI involved collection of data from a large number of households and non-household establishments, their processing and analysis. KSI has developed professional expertise geared to attend to large scale data processing and analysis needs of governmental and non-governmental organisations. In the field of data base management the Institute has developed competence to develop built-in data entry programmes as a prelude to the process of data entry and take up validation of data to ensure completeness and consistency. The following are some of the major achievements of KSI. â€¢ Need Assessment Study of Older Population in Kerala. Funded by United Nations Fund for Population Activities (UNFPA) through the Department of Health Services. Government of Kerala 2005. â€¢ Household Savings, Investments and Indebtedness in Kerala. Funded by Science, Technology and Environment Department, Government of Kerala 2003-04. â€¢ Endline Survey of ICDS III in Kerala funded by World Bank through Government of India, 2006. â€¢ Census of Computer / IT training institutions in Kerala funded by Kerala State Information Technology Mission, Government of Kerala, 2007. â€¢ Construction of a Forecasting Model for Coconut Oil Prices in India funded by Coconut Development Board, Government of India, 2007. â€¢ Field Survey on Migration in Kerala (international and internal including return migration, replacement migration) for the year 1998, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2007, 2008 and 2009. Funded by Centre for Development Studies. â€¢ Conversion of Paddy Land in Kerala, 1992- 1994 Funded by STED. â€¢ A unique study on the quality of living in 10 localities in Kerala was carried out in 1979-82. This was repeated at approximate intervals of 5 years in the same localities. â€¢ Impact of surplus land allotment in Kerala,1993- 94 Funded by Ministry of Rural Areas and Employment, Government of India. â€¢ Gender Inequality in Intra - Household Consumption Expenditure - Development of Methodology. Funded by Central Statistical Organisation 2004. â€¢ Morbidity in Kerala â€“Incidence, Prevalence and Associates. Funded by Centre for Development Studies 2003. â€¢ Household Cost of School Education in Kerala. Funded by Centre for Development Studies 2003. â€¢ Concurrent evaluation of various programmes like Integrated Rural Development Programmes, Indira Awaas Yojana, Million Wells Scheme (Kerala, Lakshadweep), Rural Development programmes (Tamil Nadu) and Impact Assessment of Watershed Development project (Karnataka). Funded by Ministry of Rural Areas and Employment, Government of India.
